title: As Most Music Is Silenced in Afghanistan, a Style Favored by the Taliban Fills the Void
sub_head: Once unwelcome, a cappella songs known as taranas now dominate the airwaves
body:
Up until the Taliban takeover on Aug. 15, Kabul restaurants used to blare out Afghan and foreign hits to attract customers. Itinerant ice cream vendors, too, played loud mechanical tunes to announce their arrival.
All of that is gone now, as Afghanistan’s capital and other big cities—bowing to Taliban beliefs that most music is un-Islamic—have gone largely quiet.
